start room.description:
You are in the Main Hub of the escape game. In front of you are three doors:
1) Server Room
2) Chemical Room
3) Teaching Lab
Choose one door to enter.

Server Room.description: You enter a room labelled 'Server Room'. The shelves are lined with various chemicals and lab equipment.
Server Room.directions:
Choose which direction to go:
1) Left
2) Forward
3) Right

1.text:
To your left is a desk with a computer. The computer is turned OFF.
Maybe you need to plug in one of the cables you saw elsewhere to power it on.
For now, nothing happens when you press the keys.

2.text:
Ahead of you is a heavy metal door. Above it, a flickering sign reads 'EXIT'.
The door is firmly locked. It looks like something else in the room might control it.

3.text:
To your right you see three cables hanging from the wall: RED, YELLOW, and GREEN.
You can try plugging one of them into the nearby power socket.
1) Plug in the RED cable
2) Plug in the YELLOW cable
3) Plug in the GREEN cable

1.text:
You plug in the RED cable. The computer on the left whirs to life and the monitor flickers on.
On the screen you see a prompt: 'ENTER PASSWORD (4 letters)'.
1) Enter the 4-letter password:
2) Return

1.success:
Correct! The computer beeps and you hear a loud click from the EXIT door.
The door swings open and you step through to the next area.
1.fail:
Incorrect password. The screen flashes red for a moment.
1) Try again?
2) Go back

2.text: You step away from the screen and go back to the entrance of the room.
You plug in the YELLOW cable. Nothing happens. The room stays dark and the computer stays OFF.

3.text:
You plug in the GREEN cable. Sparks explode from the socket and you jump back in shock.
That was definitely not the right cable. Maybe try another one.

Server Room.hint: The EXIT sign might be more important than it looks.

Chemical Room.description: You chose the room labelled 'Chemical Control Room'. There are three different options that you can see that might lead to an exit.
Chemical Room.directions:
Choose which direction to go:
1) Left
2) Forward
3) Right

1.text:
You see a set of lockers that have names of staff on them. They do not seem to be unlocked, however you wonder if you can open them another way.
1) Force them open,
2) Go back
You pull the doors of all the lockers only one opens with a key-card in it, it seems that it may open the exit.

2.text: You are back at the start of the room.
You see an acid cupboard. It has a lock on it and it seems that it need a key to be opened.

3.text:
You see a door that requires a keycard.
1) Unlock
2) Go back

1.success: Door unlocked! You move onto the next room
1.fail: Keycard needed. You cannot unlock this door yet.

2.text: You are back at the entrance to the room.

Chemical Room.hint: There are multiple different ways of leaving this room.

Teaching Lab.description: You enter an abandoned teaching lab. Benches are covered in dusty equipment, and the room feels creepily quiet.
Teaching Lab.directions:
Choose which direction to go:
1) Left
2) Forward
3) Right

1.text:
To your left is a large board covered in equations and diagrams.
Most of it is smudged and outdated.
Near the corner, one sequence of numbers is circled repeatedly:
'3142'
It looks deliberately highlighted, as if meant to be remembered.

2.text:
Straight ahead is a small room secured by a keypad.
A note above it reads: 'AUTHORIZED STAFF ONLY'.
The keypad is active, but it requires a passcode.

3.text:
To your right is the teacher's computer sitting on a desk.
The screen is on, but it's locked behind a 4-digit passcode.
1) Try to unlock the computer?
2) Go back

1.success:
Correct! The computer unlocks.
On the desktop, a file labeled 'Keypad Code' is immediately visible.
Inside is a note reading: 'Keypad Passcode: 7295'.
You unlock the door and go through to the next room
1.fail:
Incorrect passcode. The computer remains locked.
1) Try again?
2) Go Back

2.text: You go back from the computer. The screen stays lit, waiting.

Teaching Lab.hint: The board may look useless, but one detail stands out.

Research Lab.description: You enter a room labelled 'Research Lab' and see scientific equipment scattered across the room.
Research Lab.directions:
Choose which direction to go:
1) Left
2) Forward
3) Right

1.text:
To your left is a desk with a microscope.
You decide to look in the microscope. Through the lens you see four numbers in different colours:
Green: 6
Blue: 4
Red: 8
Yellow: 9
*Note added to inventory

2.text:
Ahead of you is a table with testing equipment.
On the table there are a series of test tubes lined up which contain red, green, blue, and yellow liquids.

3.text:
To your right is another door.
The door is locked.
There is a keypad which requires a 4-digit code to unlock it...
1) Enter the code?
2) Go back

1.fail:
Incorrect passcode.
1) Try again?
2) Go back

2.text: You are back at the entrance to the room.

Research Lab.hint: Look carefully at the colours of the test tubes.

Analytic Lab.description:
You step into the final room of the escape room.
Dusty monitors, scattered glassware and silent machines surround you.
Somewhere in this analytic lab is the final code you need to escape...
Analytic Lab.directions:
Choose which direction to go:
1) Left
2) Forward
3) Right

1.text:
--- Puzzle 1: The Clocks on the Wall ---
On one wall you notice two clocks side by side.
 • The first clock is ticking normally, showing a random time.
 • The second clock is completely still, its hands frozen at 12:35.

Between them, a poster reads: 'A broken clock is right two times a day.'
Beneath the clocks is a small 4-digit keypad lock.

1) Enter the 4-digit code
2) Go back

1.success:
Correct! The keypad clicks open.
You hear a soft beep from somewhere deeper in the lab.
1.fail:
ACCESS DENIED.
1) Try again
2) Go back

2.text: You step away from the clocks and return to the centre of the room.

--- Puzzle 2: The Final Research File ---
You place the research file on a clear section of the bench.
At the top of the front page is the title:

'Anomalous Lab Pathogen Hazard Assessment'

A sticky note is attached:
'He always hid things in the initials. The title was never just a title.'

A nearby terminal asks for a password.

1) Enter the password
2) Go back

1.success:
The terminal accepts the password.
Onscreen, a short log appears:
'Final note: Systems will only respond to baseline conditions. No exceptions.'
Underneath, a list of lab labels appears: Freezing point, Neutral pH, Room temp.
1.fail:
ACCESS DENIED.
1) Try again
2) Go back

2.text: You close the file and step away from the terminal.

3.text:
--- Puzzle 3: Analyzer Emergency Override ---
In the corner, a large device labelled 'Analyzer Mk III' hums quietly.
A screen above a numeric keypad reads:
'EMERGENCY OVERRIDE: ENTER BASELINE CONDITIONS.'

On the bench beside it, you see three labelled items:
 • Freezing point of water (°C)
 • Neutral pH value
 • Standard room temperature (°C)

A handwritten note is taped to the console:
'When all else fails, return to the essential conditions.'

1) Enter the 4-digit code
2) Go back

1.success:
Correct!
The final console powers down.
Emergency lights fade as the main door unlocks with a deep metallic thud.
You’ve successfully shut down the analytic lab systems and escaped the facility.
1.fail:
Incorrect code.
1) Try again
2) Go back

2.text: You step away from the Analyzer.

rooms.success: Congratulations! You have completed Room 404 Escape Room!
